item.title: 澳大利亚养老基金因 "洗绿 "被罚 1,050 万澳元
item.description: 澳大利亚养老基金 Active Super 因在环境、社会和治理方面做出大量不实陈述而被罚款 1050 万澳元（670 万美元），而监管机构正在推动杜绝 "洗绿 "行为。【原文：Australian pension fund Active Super has been fined A$10.5 million ($6.7 million) for making a number of misrepresentations about its environmental, social and governance credentials amid a regulator push to stamp out greenwashing.】

item.title: 阿尔-戈尔风险投资公司获得 1.75 亿美元，Calstrs 公司和微软公司增持现金
item.description: 由阿尔-戈尔（Al Gore）的世代投资管理公司（Generation Investment Management）创办的一家企业已筹集到 1.75 亿美元，用于投资那些能够恢复因农业和森林砍伐而退化的土地的企业。【原文：A venture started by Al Gore’s Generation Investment Management has raised $175 million to invest in businesses that enable the restoration of land degraded by agriculture and deforestation.】

item.title: 特朗普称将授权政府生产煤电
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示，他将寻求通过授权其政府提高化石燃料能源的产量来对抗中国在煤电方面的经济优势。【原文：US President Donald Trump said he would look to counter China’s economic advantage from coal-based electricity by authorizing his administration to ramp up production of energy from the fossil fuel.】

item.title: 英国保守党领袖巴德诺说："到 2050 年实现净零排放是不可能的
item.description: 保守党领袖凯米-巴德诺克（Kemi Badenoch）表示，英国无法在 2050 年前实现经济净零增长，这打破了英国主要政党的共识。【原文：The UK won’t be able to transform its economy to net zero by 2050, according to Conservative Party leader Kemi Badenoch, in a break with the consensus held by Britain’s main parties.】

item.title: 能源部长称赞特朗普曾试图废除的研究中心
item.description: 能源部长克里斯-赖特（Chris Wright）赞扬了能源部负责资助被认为风险过高而无法获得私营部门投资的研究项目的一个部门，因为人们对该部门在特朗普第二届政府中的未来存有疑问。【原文：Energy Secretary Chris Wright praised a division of the Energy Department charged with funding research projects deemed too risky to get private-sector investment, amid questions about its future in the second Trump administration.】

item.title: 保守党承诺取消加拿大工业碳税
item.description: 加拿大下一任总理的主要竞争者之一承诺取消该国的工业碳税。【原文：One of the top contenders to become Canada’s next prime minister has promised to scrap the country’s industrial carbon tax.】

item.title: 为什么我们应该担心鲸鱼停止歌唱
item.description: 饥饿的鲸鱼是安静的鲸鱼。一项新的同类首次研究发现，海洋热浪使海洋哺乳动物的猎物大量减少后，它们的叫声也减少了，这使鲸鱼的歌声成为气候变化对海洋生态系统影响的晴雨表。【原文：A hungry whale is a quiet whale. A new first-of-its kind study found the marine mammals vocalized less after a marine heat wave decimated their prey, making whale songs a barometer of the effects of climate change on ocean ecosystems.】

item.title: 在特朗普的反击下，瑞银从年报中删除了德意志银行的内容
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）的年度报告不再提及一个受到特朗普政府攻击的关键可持续发展术语，这表明了特朗普政府的反弹对欧洲企业的影响。【原文：UBS Group AG’s annual report no longer refers to a key sustainability term that has come under attack from the Trump administration, indicating how the backlash is impacting European firms.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚因评级焦虑拒绝债务换自然交易
item.description: 哥伦比亚前环境部长表示，哥伦比亚一直拒绝以债务换自然的提议，因为担心这样的交易会影响其主权信用评级。【原文：Colombia has been rejecting offers to do a debt-for-nature swap over fears such a deal could impact its sovereign credit rating, according to the country’s former environment minister.】

item.title: 天气转暖，中国冬季发电量罕见下降
item.description: 由于冬季气温较低，中国的发电量在年初出现了罕见的下降，这给煤炭和天然气等发电厂燃料的价格带来了更大的压力。【原文：China’s electricity output suffered a rare early-year decline amid milder winter temperatures, adding to pressure on prices of power plant fuels like coal and gas.】

item.title: 华盛顿、美国大西洋中部地区周日面临越来越大的风暴风险
item.description: 本周末，龙卷风和恶劣天气造成密西西比河流域和南部数以千计的地区停电，在此之后，新一轮风暴将于周日席卷从伊利湖到佛罗里达州的美国东部地区，包括克利夫兰和坦帕。【原文：Another round of storms will sweep into the eastern US from Lake Erie to Florida, including Cleveland and Tampa, on Sunday after a deadly track of tornadoes and severe weather knocked out power to thousands across the Mississippi Valley and the South this weekend.】

item.title: 美国大风暴引发龙卷风和野火，造成至少 32 人死亡
item.description: 美国密苏里州皮埃蒙特（美联社）— 狂暴的龙卷风和大风摧毁了房屋，摧毁了学校，掀翻了半拖拉机拖车，一场造成至少 32 人死亡的特大风暴横扫美国中部和南部地区。【原文：PIEDMONT, Mo. (AP) — Violent tornadoes and high winds decimated homes, wiped out schools and toppled semitractor-trailers as a monster storm that killed at least 32 people ripped its way across the central and southern U.S.】

item.title: 致命风暴袭击美国中西部，南部地区面临极端风险
item.description: 周六，导致密苏里州数人死亡的大规模风暴系统正向密西西比河谷和美国南部移动，促使美国国家气象局发出警告，"可能会出现猛烈的长轨迹龙卷风"。【原文：A massive storm system that left several people dead in Missouri was moving toward the Mississippi Valley and US south on Saturday, prompting the National Weather Service to warn of “the potential for violent, long-track tornadoes.”】

item.title: 大风暴引发狂风，龙卷风威胁移至美国南部
item.description: 美国俄克拉荷马市（美联社）— 星期六，龙卷风的威胁向东转移到密西西比河谷和南部深处，而在这之前的一天，一个横跨美国的巨大风暴系统掀起的狂风破坏了建筑物，掀起的沙尘暴造成了致命的撞车事故，并在中部几个州引发了 100 多场野火。【原文：OKLAHOMA CITY (AP) — The threat of tornadoes moved east into the Mississippi Valley and Deep South on Saturday, a day after a massive storm system moving across the country unleashed winds that damaged buildings, whipped up dust storms that caused deadly crashes and fanned more than 100 wildfires in several central states.】

item.title: 特朗普反对该项目后，近海风电场许可证失效
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布希望该项目 "寿终正寝 "七周后，行政上诉委员会宣布计划在新泽西海岸附近建设的海上风电场的关键许可无效。【原文：A critical permit for an offshore wind farm planned near the New Jersey Shore has been invalidated by an administrative appeals board, seven weeks after President Donald Trump declared he hoped the project was “dead and gone.”】

item.title: 德国为气候事业拨款 1,000 亿欧元，清洁技术股上涨
item.description: 德国的新支出协议为气候项目划拨了 1,000 亿欧元（1,090 亿美元）的专项资金，这给可能从这波额外资金中受益的绿色能源公司带来了冲击。【原文：Germany’s new spending deal, which earmarks €100 billion ($109 billion) for climate projects, gave a jolt to green energy companies that could benefit from the wave of extra funding.】

item.title: 暴雨引发托斯卡纳洪灾，意大利进入红色警报状态
item.description: 雷雨夹杂着暴雨引发了意大利多个城市的洪水，航班受阻，当局被迫关闭学校、市场和其他公共场所。【原文：Thunderstorms packing torrential rains triggered flooding across a number of Italian cities, disrupting flights and forcing the authorities to close schools, markets and other public areas.】

item.title: 德国机构警告不要终止化石燃料供暖禁令

item.title: 研究称，随着排放量增加，欧洲冬季风暴将更加严重

item.title: 富裕国家实现净零排放需要什么：你
item.description: 如果您住在英国，您的洗碗机和冰箱的碳足迹已经减少了很多，这主要是因为政府和公司花费了数十亿英镑安装风能和太阳能。在过去的 35 年里，这一转变帮助减少了 80% 的发电排放。【原文：If you live in the UK, your dishwasher and fridge’s carbon footprint has shrunk by a lot, largely because the government and companies have spent billions of pounds to install wind and solar power. Over the past 35 years, that switch has helped cut emissions from electricity generation by 80%.】
